title: iPhone 12 review: Upgrade for the camera, not 5G
description: Deciding whether — or when — to upgrade your smartphone is hard. Besides some attempts at swanky foldable phones, the look of smartphones hasn't changed much in recent years. Most improvements, while technologically impressive, mostly feel minor to the average consumer. But Apple's latest iPhone lineup has analysts predicting tons of upgrades.

title: Convalescent plasma did not reduce Covid-19 deaths or keep patients from severe illness in new study
description: In a new study, convalescent plasma did not reduce deaths among Covid-19 patients or prevent moderate disease from becoming severe.

title: ICE plans to target undocumented immigrants who didn't voluntarily leave US
description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement plans to launch an operation to find and deport undocumented immigrants who failed to voluntarily depart the United States despite previously committing to do so, according to a draft memo obtained by CNN.

title: 70% of Americans support same-sex marriage -- a new high -- a new survey finds
description: A new survey indicates there's been a sea change in public support for same-sex marriage.

title: Judge drops third-degree murder charge against ex-officer in George Floyd's death, but second-degree murder charge remains
description: A Hennepin County judge has dropped a third-degree murder charge against former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin in the killing of George Floyd.

title: Bubba Wallace's new NASCAR team reveals Michael Jordan inspired team name, number and logo
description: NASCAR racer Bubba Wallace will be sporting a new number and car while racing with a new team in 2021.

title: FDA approves remdesivir to treat Covid-19
description: The US Food and Drug Administration approved remdesivir for the treatment of coronavirus infection, the drug's maker, Gilead Sciences, said Thursday.

title: Vatican extends secretive deal with China on appointing bishops
description: The Vatican says it has extended its controversial agreement with China over the appointment of bishops for another two years.

title: This company makes sure you never run out of coffee
description: Startup Bottomless uses a connected scale to measure customers' coffee consumption and send automatic refills. Its co-founder explains how the pandemic has affected business.

title: This fourth-grader doesn't have WiFi at home. So he walks to school
description: A fourth-grader without internet access at home was caught sitting outside his shuttered school doing homework. CNN speaks to him and his mother.

title: Museum visitor recognizes long-lost painting from neighbor's private collection
description: A long-lost painting by famed Black American modernist Jacob Lawrence is back on public display for the first time in decades.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell's 2016 deposition transcript has been unsealed
description: The 2016 deposition of Jeffery Epstein's former girlfriend and alleged accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell was unsealed early Thursday, after she lost an appeal earlier this week to keep the document sealed.

title: Elton John is getting his own Barbie doll
description: Elton John is getting his very own Barbie doll. And while the doll won't look like the Rocket Man, it will be styled in his likeness.

title: Google's defense against antitrust lawsuit? You
description: In its two decades, Google has amassed a dizzying amount of power, building a search and advertising behemoth that many critics believe is an illegal monopoly. But the fact you get most of Google's services for free, and that many people seem to prefer them over alternatives, could -— Google hopes — save it from a landmark federal lawsuit challenging that alleged monopoly.

title: CBS News blasts White House for posting Trump's '60 Minutes' interview online
description: CBS News on Thursday called out the White House for violating an agreement it had with the network and posting President Trump's full "60 Minutes" interview online ahead of its Sunday air date.

title: CNN Heroes: Delivering RVs to firefighters who lost their homes
description: Six volunteer firefighters from Berry Creek, CA, lost their homes while battling the flames. Within days, CNN Hero Woody Faircloth found RVs for them to call home, for now. This is nothing new for the founder of EmergencyRV.org.

title: US considering declaring major human rights organizations are anti-Semitic
description: The US State Department is considering declaring that several widely respected human rights organizations are anti-Semitic, according to multiple sources who have been made aware of the conversations.

title: John King: The map gives Trump and Biden these options
description: CNN's John King breaks down the latest electoral college projections ahead of the final presidential debate.

title: Airline puts all-business class jets on regular routes
description: Air Canada's Jetz aircraft are usually chartered by the 1%. Now the airline is putting them on commercial routes for the holidays

title: Prison set on fire in Nigeria as protest death toll rises to at least 56
description: At least 56 people have died across Nigeria since the #EndSARS protests began on October 8, with 38 killed across the country on Tuesday alone, according to human rights group Amnesty International.

title: 50 years on, 1970 World Cup-winning team remains Brazil's greatest ever
description: Every so often, a national team comes along that embeds itself in a nation's psyche.

title: Lily Allen launches sex toy, encouraging women to talk confidently about pleasure
description: Lily Allen has teamed up with a German sex toy brand to launch her own sex toy -- and start a discussion about female sexuality.

title: Baby gorilla hand-reared by zookeepers after mother struggles to look after him
description: Zookeepers in the British city of Bristol are giving a baby gorilla round-the-clock care, including bottle feeding through the night, as his mother has been struggling to look after him.

title: Europe is fighting a seemingly unstoppable second wave
description: • LIVE: These are all the places reporting a new daily record of Covid-19 cases

title: Endangered frogs rescued from muddy puddle in desert have 200 offspring
description: A clutch of critically-endangered water frogs rescued from a muddy puddle in Chile's driest desert has birthed 200 offspring at the country's national zoo, the Chilean government announced on Wednesday.

title: Scientists have found a rare half-male, half-female songbird
description: It may not be one in a million, but it's pretty close.

title: The most important line in Obama's takedown of Trump
description: Former President Barack Obama reemerged on the campaign trail Wednesday in Philadelphia, delivering an across-the-board indictment of his successor's first four years in office.

title: Banksy's 'Show me the Monet' painting sells for nearly $10 million
description: Banksy's take on a Claude Monet masterpiece has sold for £7.6 million ($9.8 million) following a nine-minute bidding battle, auctioneers at Sotheby's have said.

title: Protesters wanted change but Lebanon's elite picks veteran Saad Hariri to lead crisis-wracked country
description: Former Lebanese Prime Minister Saad Hariri, who was toppled in a popular uprising nearly one year ago, has been tasked with forming the crisis-plagued country's next government.

title: Israelis can now travel to Dubai. The Persian Gulf will never be the same.
description: The moment travel restrictions from the coronavirus pandemic are lifted, Peleg Cohen knows exactly where he is headed. The Israeli-born travel blogger, photographer and humanitarian, 37, says he has been on the road since his early 20s, visiting 150 countries and chronicling it all for his travel blog, Lonely Peleg.

title: US officials say Russia and Iran have interfered with the presidential election
description: Director of National Intelligence John Ratcliffe said Wednesday that Iran and Russia have obtained US voter registration information and are trying to influence public opinion ahead of the election.

title: Japan has so few women politicians that when even one is gaffe-prone, all pay a price
description: Laast month, Japanese lawmaker Mio Sugita caused outrage on social media when she said that some women lie about sexual assaults.

title: Analysis: A Supreme Court decision has likely transformed election night -- but it comes with a  warning
description: A major Supreme Court decision has likely transformed election night with a huge break for Democrats -- but it comes with a chilling warning of how the conservative majority might decide future voting disputes.

title: Former US President airs his most direct attacks on Trump in return to campaign trail, leveling both substantive critiques and personal barbs
description: Former President Barack Obama delivered a blistering account of his successor's first four years in office on Wednesday in Philadelphia, arguing that President Donald Trump has proved he is "incapable of taking the job seriously" and has shown no interest in "helping anybody but himself and his friends."

title: Pope endorses civil union laws for same-sex couples
description: Pope Francis has declared support for civil unions for same-sex couples for the first time, according to the Catholic News Agency.
